issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
Expected Behavior:

I should be able to set ACS keys in the tiapp.xml. 

Actual Behavior:

I must set them in code.

See https://github.com/joshthecoder/todo_titanium_bb10 for a sample app. Comment out the ACS key in app.js. The app builds, but you cannot log in. You're not able to connect to ACS. 

I tried by creating my own app (and thus ACS keys), creating an initial user object via the ACS control panel, and then building. I have to put my keys into the app.js file or the Login button does nothing.
fields.summary: BlackBerry: Cannot access ACS keys from tiapp.xml

comments.body:
Verified fixed on:
Mac OSX 10.9 Mavericks
Titanium Studio, build: 3.2.0.201311122225
Titanium SDK, build: 3.2.0.v20131113094843
CLI: 3.2.0
Alloy: 1.3.0
BlackBerry Simulator: 10.2.0.1791

Created app using code sample given in description.
ACS key created in tiapp.xml and accessed successfully.
User created in ACS control panel and logged in successfully.
Closing.
